conclusion: Analyze the p-V diagram and use the ideal gas law.
State A: p_A = 3 x 10^5 Pa, V_A = 1 x 10^-3 m^3; State B: p_B = 1 x 10^5 Pa, V_B = 1 x 10^-3 m^3; State C: p_C = 1 x 10^5 Pa, V_C = 3 x 10^-3 m^3.
Process AB is isochoric because the volume remains constant.
Process BC is isobaric because the pressure remains constant.
The ideal gas law is PV = nRT.
During isochoric process AB, temperature remains constant.
Temperature at state A is 27Â°C = 300.15 K.
Temperature at state B is the same as at state A, T_B = 300.15 K.
The temperature of the gas at state B is 300.15 K.
